alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Martin; Nicollet; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:01AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Martin, Brown, northwestern Blue Earth, Watonwan and Nicollet Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 501 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Butterfield, or 17 miles east of Windom, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... St. James around 505 AM CDT. Hanska around 520 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Ulm, Courtland and Lafayette. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 78 and 130. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 41 and 51, between mile markers 56 and 59, between mile markers 61 and 68, and between mile markers 70 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.

area.areaDesc: Blue Earth; Brown; Martin; Nicollet; Watonwan
